semantic_title: Outpatient Encounter Conditions Prior to Inpatient Admission
section_path: Present on Admission Guidelines > Assigning the POA Indicator > Condition develops during outpatient encounter prior to inpatient admission

content.full_text: Assign Y for any condition that develops during an outpatient encounter prior to a written order for inpatient admission. (Evidence: pg no: 118, L31-L32)
content.summary: Conditions that develop during outpatient encounters before inpatient admission orders should receive Y indicator (Evidence: pg no: 118, L31-L32)
key_concepts: Outpatient encounter development (Evidence: pg no: 118, L31-L32)
Written admission order timing (Evidence: pg no: 118, L32)
Y indicator assignment (Evidence: pg no: 118, L32)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign Y for conditions developing during outpatient encounter before admission order (Evidence: pg no: 118, L32)
detailed_rules.explanation: Any condition that develops during an outpatient encounter prior to the written order for inpatient admission should be considered present on admission (Evidence: pg no: 118, L31-L32)

workflow_steps: Step 2: Determine timing of written admission order
Step 3: If condition developed before admission order, assign Y

code_categories_mentioned: All conditions developing in outpatient encounters

references_to.title: POA Definition
references_to.explanation: Implements the POA definition that includes outpatient encounter conditions

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient develops pneumonia in ED before admission order
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient seen in ED for chest pain, develops pneumonia during ED stay, then admitted
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify pneumonia developed in ED
Step 2: Confirm this was before admission order

correct_coding.rationale: Pneumonia developed during outpatient encounter before admission order (Evidence: pg no: 118, L31-L32)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Should not assign N to conditions developing before admission order

warnings: Must consider timing relative to written admission order (Evidence: pg no: 118, L31-L32)
best_practices: Review outpatient encounter documentation carefully (Evidence: pg no: 118, L31-L32)
common_mistakes: Not considering outpatient encounter developments (Evidence: pg no: 118, L31-L32)
tips: Look for timing of admission order in documentation (Evidence: pg no: 118, L32)
implementation_notes: Train coders on outpatient encounter POA rules
clinical_context: Conditions can develop during ED, observation, or outpatient surgery
